definition: A person's intellect.
sentence: She used her mind to solve the puzzle.

definition: The color at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet.
sentence: The apple was bright red.

definition: To perceive with the eyes.
sentence: He can see the mountain from his window.

definition: Enjoyment, amusement, or lighthearted pleasure.
sentence: They had a lot of fun at the party.

definition: Move downward, typically rapidly and freely without control.
sentence: Leaves fall from the trees in autumn.

definition: Move at a speed faster than a walk.
sentence: She likes to run every morning.

definition: Say something in order to obtain an answer or some information.
sentence: He decided to ask for directions.

definition: Of the most excellent or desirable type or quality.
sentence: She is the best player on the team.

definition: Give someone money that is due for work done, goods received, or a debt incurred.
sentence: He needs to pay the bill.

definition: A naturally raised area of land, not as high or craggy as a mountain.
sentence: They climbed up the hill.

definition: The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
sentence: We breathe air to live.

definition: Have or retain possession of.
sentence: She wants to keep the book.

definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins living wholly in water.
sentence: They caught a big fish.

definition: The lowest cardinal number; half of two.
sentence: There is one apple left.

definition: The paired respiratory organ of fish and some amphibians.
sentence: Fish breathe through gills.

definition: An Indian term for religious reading or recitation.
sentence: He attended the path at the temple.

definition: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
sentence: The rain was heavy last night.

definition: A noise made by air released from the stomach through the mouth.
sentence: He let out a loud burp after drinking soda.

definition: A portable shelter made of fabric, supported by poles and ropes, used for camping.
sentence: They set up the tent by the lake.

definition: Affected by physical or mental illness.
sentence: She is feeling sick today.

definition: A system of words, letters, figures, or symbols used to represent others, especially for the purposes of secrecy.
sentence: He wrote the code for the new app.

definition: A network of paths and hedges designed as a puzzle through which one has to find a way.
sentence: They got lost in the maze.

definition: A small vessel for traveling over water.
sentence: They rowed the boat across the lake.

definition: The day of the month or year as specified by a number.
sentence: Today's date is June 22.

definition: Make something neat or of the required size or form by cutting away irregular or unwanted parts.
sentence: He will trim the hedge tomorrow.
